required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Water-only Fasting and Refeeding on Body Composition
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study on the Effects of Water-only Fasting and Refeeding on Body Composition and Insulin Resistance

brief_summary.textblock: This observational pilot study will assess the effects of water-only fasting on body composition and insulin resistance

detailed_description.textblock: This pilot study will explore the effects of water-only fasting followed by an exclusively whole-plant-food diet free of added salt, oil, and sugar on body composition with a particular focus on visceral adipose tissue (VAT). The study will also extend a previous study assessing the effects of fasting and refeeding on Homeostatic Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR) values and markers of cardiovascular health and inflammation by following participants for an additional 6 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean changes in visceral adipose tissue from baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
primary_outcome.description: Visceral adipose tissue will be estimated using Holigic Horizon dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) machine and reported in grams

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean changes in total fat and lean mass and bone mineral content (BMC) from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
secondary_outcome.description: Total fat and lean mass and BMC will be estimated using Holigic Horizon dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) machine and reported in grams

other_outcome.measure: Mean changes in lipid profile from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
other_outcome.description: Lipid profile will be assessed using serum to measure cholesterol, triglycerides, high-density lipoprotein (HDL), and lowdensity lipoprotein (LDL) and reported in mg/dL

other_outcome.measure: Mean changes in weight from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
other_outcome.description: Weight will be measured on a digital scale and reported in kilograms (kg)

other_outcome.measure: Mean changes in insulin resistance from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
other_outcome.description: Insulin resistance will be assessed using serum glucose and insulin to calculate homeostatic model of insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) [fasting insulin (microU/L) x fasting glucose (nmol/L)/22.5]

other_outcome.measure: Mean changes in abdominal circumference from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
other_outcome.description: Abdominal circumference will be measured on bare skin at the minimal waistline with a tension-sensitive, non-elastic tape and reported in centimeters (cm)

other_outcome.measure: Mean changes in high sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP) from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
other_outcome.description: hsCRP will assessed using serum and reported in mg/L

other_outcome.measure: Mean changes in Gamma-Glutamyl-Transferase (GGT) from baseline
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 10 to 40 days after baseline, up to 5 to 20 days after end of fast, 6-weeks after end of refeed
other_outcome.description: GGT will assessed using serum and reported in U/L

arm_group.description: Overweight and obese, non-diabetic participants undergoing elective water-only fasting treatment

intervention.description: In-patient water-only fasting for at least 10 days followed by at least 5 days of refeeding

study_pop.textblock: Overweight and obese, non-diabetic participants chosen from voluntary patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any gender
- 40-70 years old
- Fasting plasma glucose <126mg/dL and/or hemoglobin A1c <7%
- BMI between 25 and 40 kg/m2
- Elect and qualify for a water-only fast of at least 10 consecutive days
- Provide informed consent
- Internet and computer access
- Able to return for 6-week follow-up visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active malignancy
- Active inflammatory disorder including classic autoimmune connective tissue (Lupus, Sjogrens, ANCA), multiple sclerosis, and inflammatory bowel disorders (Ulcerative colitis, Crohn's)
- Stroke or heart attack within the last 12 months
- Break water-only fast before 10 days with juice or food.
- Break water-only fast after 10 days with juice or food before end-of-fast blood draw occurs.
- Leave center before completing at least 5 days of refeeding
- Unable to lay still on the back for at least 10 min
- Abdominal metal implants
